pages.text: After $(l:concepts/wild_magic)the fall of the Order of Druids$(), many sought to enhance the power of Wild Magic in order to make it equivalent to that which they had lost.$(br2)While their purpose was selfish, the resulting Grove Stone was surprisingly useful as a magnifier of wild magic, and as a catalyst for crafting.$(br2)Simulating the Fey was not

pages.name: Grove Stone

something that these latter Druids were capable of, and it remains unclear whether it is even possible to do so.$(br2)Regardless, when combined with an appropriately attuned device, Grove Stones allow for a greater range of crafting and creation.$(br2)Some posit they harness power from the Fey via minute portals, large enough for energy but too small to be seen, but the exact method remains unclear.

pages.text: $(o)Despite lacking evidence, often called a 'Fey' crafter.$()
